subhead: The 2025 Tour de France marks the 40th anniversary of the last overall victory by a Frenchman. Despite the lack of homegrown champs, the public's enthusiasm remains undiminished.

In France, asylum seekers navigate labyrinth of Europe's Dublin Regulation
subhead: '2015-2025: Europe's migration crisis' (3/5). In the 1990s, the European Union established the Dublin Regulation, aiming to prevent asylum seekers from filing applications in multiple countries. The massive influx of refugees over the past 10 years has shattered the system, which is no longer implemented in all EU member states.

headline: At least 24 are dead and more than 20 children missing in Texas flash flood
subhead: More than 20 girls at a summer camp in South-Central Texas remain unaccounted for after devastating floods swept through the region Northwest of San Antonio: 'The rain has let up, but we know there's another wave coming.'

headline: The Seine will reopen to public swimming for the first time in a century
subhead: The long-polluted waterway is finally opening up as a summertime swim spot; the city's authorities have given the green light for the public opening, with water quality results consistently in line with European regulations.

headline: Mohamed El Khatib, playwright: 'When Arabic rings out, a sinister music accompanies it. That of contempt.'
subhead: With the Arabic language as the guest of honor at the Avignon Festival, running from July 5 to 26, playwright Mohamed El Khatib shares his regret over having let his mother tongue slip away from him and his daughter.

'I was raped for three days': Ukrainian police investigate war crimes
subhead: In November 2022, after being detained by police near Melitopol, Hanna Peklo was raped by a Russian soldier. The Ukrainian war crimes department has identified her rapist.

headline: Corsican mafia undergoing 'major recomposition,' intelligence report says
subhead: According to French crime investigators, new power balances are emerging between two blocs on the Mediterranean island: the Petit Bar gang and the Mattei clan, which is uniting groups from various regions.

headline: Kyiv suffers sleepless night as Russia hits capital with record drone attack
subhead: Russia launched 550 drones and missiles against Ukraine overnight from Thursday to Friday, primarily targeting the capital. According to the spokesperson for the Ukrainian Air Force, these raids marked the largest assault since Russia's full-scale invasion of the country in 2022.
